revised_title: Ancient English Weight and Measure: An Historical Overview
tldr: The author investigates the historical development of English weights and measures, focusing on the ancient standards established during the reign of William the Conqueror. The study reveals that the legal pound weight and gallon measure remained consistent from the 11th century until the 16th century, with the Saxon pound being lighter than the present Troy pound and the gallon measure containing 8 pounds of wheat.
